alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 06 at 8:28PM CST until March 06 at 9:15PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Ozark County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 915 PM CST. * At 828 PM CST, a tornado producing storm was located 11 miles west of Gainesville, or 19 miles north of Bull Shoals, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Bull Shoals Lake... Theodosia... Sundown... Thornfield... Brixey... Sycamore... Noble... Willhoit... Dora... Rockbridge... Zanoni... Gentryville... TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
